text:
Palisade Ave. (foreground), at the N.E. corner of Independence Ave., showing a 2-story stucco house occupying that site. Across the roof of the house, in the background, is the I.G. Johnson Mansion, on a lofty hill at the S.E. corner of Henry Hudson Parkway and Kappock Street. The driveway on which the truck is parked is Independence Ave. The G.W. Bromley map of 1924 as revised to September 1932 shows the house to be on block 3407, lot No. 201.

May 25, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Independence Avenue (lower left corner across face of view), north from Palisade Avenue, showing part of Spuyten Duyvil Hill, in the Bronx, west of the Henry Hudson Bridge. In the right background, at W. 227th Street, is the Henry Hudson Monument; on the left, among the trees, is the Berrien House, dating back to pre-Revolutionary days.

May 25, 1937

P. L. Sperr

(2) Another view of the same area.

July 15, 1939

P. L. Sperr

(3) A more extensive view of Spuyten Duyvil Hill, with the Henry Hudson Bridge appearing on the right. In the lower left hand corner is the Spuyten Duyvil station of the New York Central Railroad and in the center background, perched atop the hill, is the new St. Frances Schervier Hospital, Catholic institution for the aged.

July 15, 1939

P. L. Sperr

(1) Independence Avenue (lower left corner across face of view), north from Palisade Avenue, showing part of Spuyten Duyvil Hill, in the Bronx, west of the Henry Hudson Bridge. P. L. Sperr

Independence Ave., east side, between Palisade Ave. and Kappock Street, showing in a set of two views, the Edgehill Church. (Pres.) The view is in a northerly direction.

May 25, 1937.

P.L. Sperr.

Independence Ave., east side, between Palisade Ave. and Kappock Street, showing in a set of two views, the Edgehill Church. (Pres.) The view is in a northerly direction.

May 25, 1937.

P.L. Sperr.

2505 Palisade Avenue, south side, east of Independence Avenue, showing an old frame house, on Spuyten Duyvil Hill. It belonged to G. E. Mann in 1879; and to D. B. Cox in 1900. The view is eastward toward the Bronx end of the Henry Hudson Bridge. Palisade Avenue is the road on the left, with fence.

P. L. Sperr

May 25, 1937

2505 Palisade Avenue, south side, east of Independence Avenue, showing an old frame house, on Spuyten Duyvil Hill. It belonged to G. E. Mann in 1879; and to D. B. Cox in 1900. The view is eastward toward the Bronx end of the Henry Hudson Bridge. Palisade Avenue is the road on the left, with fence.

P. L. Sperr

May 25, 1937
